result.execSummary:
The defendant Janet J Karger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with Target Stores. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours, release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Janet J Karger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order for Early Discharge of Probation, granted, signed and filed.
Request for early discharge of probation, dated 12/28/16, submitted by Agent Stedman.
letter from Lutheran Counseling & Family Services of Wisconsin
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Janet J Karger in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with:  Target stores


FINE/COSTS:  $515.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  20 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Janet J Karger in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a date for plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Janet J Karger in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kershek requests another furtther proceeding for Defendant to continue counseling.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with witnesses and business, Target Store in City of New Berlin, listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Janet J Karger in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
